comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: That's R.C. Beadle and A.H. Brown, apparently members of the  "Men's League for Women's Suffrage"

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The banner reads: "Men's League for Woman Suffrage of the State of New York."

comment.author: 24231207@N07
comment._content: R.C. Beadle was the Secretary of the Men's League for Woman Suffrage of the State of New York.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Robert Cameron Beadle, according to History of woman suffrage, Volume 6 (by Susan Brownell Anthony, Matilda Joslyn Gage, Ida Husted Harper) page 485 books.google.com/books?id=l1MOAQAAIAAJ&pg=PA460&l...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The "48" (thanks, Wystan) indicates that this was 48 East 34th St., headquarters of the Woman Suffrage Party of Manhattan. See NYT of August 26, 1913 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F06E0DB163DE633A...

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: All:  Thanks for the additional information about these fellows.  We'll include it next time we update the record.
